node.title: 'A cloud's been lifted': Queensland business owners on a much-needed high as bookings surge
node.description: After nearly two years of battling pandemic restrictions and impacts of border closures, Queensland businesses say the border reopening has created a sense of hope and optimism.
node.content:
["For Gold Coast surf school owner Pat O'Leary, the sound of planes landing at the nearby airport\u00a0has\u00a0become cause for excitement.", "After nearly two years of battling pandemic restrictions and impacts of border closures, he said the border reopening on Monday had\u00a0created a sense of hope and optimism in the community, particularly ahead of the Christmas holiday season.", "\"It's fantastic, I used to get annoyed at the sound of the planes but now I'm like, 'Beauty, there's another load [of visitors]',\" he said.", "\"A\u00a0lot of people have suffered, so I know they're super excited about getting back to\u00a0work to make some dough.\"", "", "
This Gold Coast surf school is glad to be busy again.(ABC Gold Coast:\u00a0Heidi Sheehan)
", "The Surf Easy Surf School owner said, while customers were beginning to trickle back and businesses were preparing for a bumper Christmas break,\u00a0a sense of apprehension was still in the air.", "\"We've noticed more people around and we're expecting Christmas to be busy, but advanced bookings have been down a bit.\u00a0Now people are booking the day or so before,\" he said.", "\"But in general we are still expecting many people once they actually get here to start booking and doing things.\"", "", "
Hairdresser and owner KT Hair, Lee Forbutt, says\u00a0businesses are beginning to feel hopeful again.(ABC Gold Coast:\u00a0Ellie Grounds)
", "Coolangatta hair salon owner Lee Forbutt agreed, saying\u00a0fear of a snap border closure had deterred some interstate visitors, but businesses were more worried about whether their old customers would return.", "\"I think there's a lot of apprehension that the border will shut any minute and they'll get trapped,\" she said.", "\"So we've had a lot of people say no they won't be coming.", "But she said so far\u00a0things were looking good, with\u00a0traffic delays not nearly as bad as anticipated, and phones beginning to ring again.", "\"I think everyone's been\u00a0pleasantly surprised,\" she said.", "\"Lots\u00a0of customers, 50 per cent of them\u00a0have started to ring back and book in, which is lovely.", "\"I think everyone can see a little bit of hope now, as long as they do stay open.\"", "", "
Motorists waiting to get into Queensland from New South Wales on day two of the border reopening.(ABC Gold Coast:\u00a0Steve Keen)
", "
No border closures over Christmas
", "According to Queensland's Deputy Premier Steven Miles,\u00a0the government has\u00a0put plans\u00a0in place to ensure no border closures happen\u00a0over the Christmas period, even as Covid cases are\u00a0expected to rise.", "He said Queensland would likely adopt a similar approach to South Australia.", "\"I think the modelling suggests that even as cases start to arrive they won't be reaching peak kind of levels until into March.\"", "", "
Gus Daresi\u00a0says\u00a0it has\u00a0been great to welcome back regular customers from across the border.(ABC Gold Coast:\u00a0Ellie Grounds)
", "Coolangatta Oakberry owner Gus Daseri said\u00a0businesses were looking forward to beginning\u00a0their road to recovery.", "\"We are excited that this has finally finished and we can get back to our routine,\" he said.", "\"Everything is coming together now. It's school holidays and the border is open.", "\"Only yesterday, we already had a really good day with a lot of people coming and happy to be back so yeah, you can feel the vibes already.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
